page.title: 15Transport, Trefriw & Maenan
page.content: There are 2 North/South roads, one on each side of the River Conwy, and between them is a single-line railway. 6 trains run daily in winter, 9 in summer,except Sunday. It connects with the narrow-gauge steam Ffestiniog railway ending at Porthmadog, and is popular with tourists. A footbridge crosses the Conwy River in the adjacent block, but there is no vehicular bridge other than those at Llanrwst and Tal y Cafn. The bus through Trefriw runs hourly between Llanrwst and Llandudno ending too early at night for villagers to enjoy coastal entertainments. Maenan has a single bus from Colwyn Bay to Llanrwst on Market and Fairday and one to Liverpool and Chester on Thursdays and Saturdays.A summer only service goes to Porthmadog,Beddgelert, and Llanberis.
